definitions.definition: To put down; to lay down; to deposit; to lay aside; to put away.
To remove (a leader) from (high) office, without killing the incumbent.
definitions.example: A deposed monarch may go into exile as pretender to the lost throne, hoping to be restored in a subsequent revolution.

definitions.definition: To give evidence or testimony, especially in response to interrogation during a deposition
To interrogate and elicit testimony from during a deposition; typically done by a lawyer.
definitions.example: After we deposed the claimant we had enough evidence to avoid a trial.

definitions.definition: To take or swear an oath.
To testify; to bear witness; to claim; to assert; to affirm.
